page.title: 01Shouldham area.
page.content: Our block consists of farmland and two villages. It is bisected by the A134 road. The area is basically flat and parts are planted with coniferous woodland part of which is being superceeded by broad leaved trees. The main crops grown are cereals and sugar beet plus livestock. Some of the farms are given over to intensive pig rearing and one farm is producing apples and pears with much re-planting being done in the last year. The South East corner of the block is park land belonging to Sir John Bagge of Stradsett Hall. The children of Shouldham Thorpe attend the village school and the shop/P.O. in Shouldham also serves both villages. Each village has its own church, part of Fincham group.
